description: Bishop Andrew Watson says is calling on those making Lent sacrifices to donate to a community fund.
title: Bishop of Guildford's Lent appeal addresses Surrey's 'growing needs'
title_page: Bishop of Guildford's Lent appeal addresses Surrey's 'growing needs' - BBC News
maintext:
The Bishop of Guildford has said his diocese's 2025 Lent appeal, launched on Wednesday, the first day of the season, will address the "growing needs" of communities in Surrey.
The Right Reverend Andrew Watson said he is hoping to top the Â£24,000 raised by the appeal Bishop of Guildford's Community Fund in 2024.
The money will be distributed to community groups which work with deprived and vulnerable people.
Lent lasts for the 40 days leading to Easter Day, not including Sundays, with Christians traditionally giving up luxuries and donating the money saved to good causes.
